title: The Industrial revolution: beginnings in the United States
creator_credit: Lee Kohns, Dennis Azzarella, John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
brief_description: Traces the explosive growth of the Inudstrial Revolution in the United States - beginning with a thread mill built in 1791, followed by the first modern factory in history. Explains how labor-saving machines, mass production techniques, rapid communication devices increased the standard of living and how the development of fast transportation made the whole continent a market place. Part of the Rise of Industrial America series.
